It's important to know what should be left out when building a visualization.

Chart junk refers all information in a visualizaiton that are not necessary to comprehend the main message. They could distract the viewer from the message.

Information can be considered chart junk if they are not part of the minimal information needed for clear communication.


A few examples of chart junk:

* Heavy or dark grid lines (the ones in the background)
* Unnecessary text
* Pictures sorroudning or within graphs
* Shading or 3D components
* Ornaments charts or axes.
